content:
• Monday, July 16, 2012
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm's (NASDAQ:MFRM) Q2 warning takes a toll on other mattress stocks. TPX -6.1%. SCSS...

    Mattress Firm's (NASDAQ:MFRM) Q2 warning takes a toll on other mattress stocks. TPX -6.1%. SCSS -7.4%. The warning comes 6 weeks after Tempur Pedic cut its 2012 sales outlook, and bolsters bear arguments about weakening consumer demand. MFRM now -12.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation (NASDAQ:DGIT) has resumed trading after announcing it would explore strategic...

    Digital Generation (NASDAQ:DGIT) has resumed trading after announcing it would explore strategic alternatives. Shares +19.7% AH to $11.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) files a 3.7M share registration statement. Stock -5.6% AH.

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI) files a 3.7M share registration statement. Stock -5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • PKG

    Packaging of America (NYSE:PKG): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $712M (+7.1% Y/Y)...

    Packaging of America (NYSE:PKG): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $712M (+7.1% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAST

    Shares of ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) are getting hit after saying its former VP Shi...

    Shares of ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) are getting hit after saying its former VP Shi Shicheng has been detained by police since mid-June on suspected involvement in loan fraud and misappropriation of school funds during the period from 2009 and 2012. The company has obtained bank statements indicating there may have been a series of cash transfers between Mr. Shi Shicheng’s son, Shi Qinyan, and the company that were not authorized by the company’s board of directors. Shares -7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) -4.4% AH following its announcement of a 20M share common stock...

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) -4.4% AH following its announcement of a 20M share common stock offering. LNG says it intends to use the net proceeds to repay the $204M principal amount outstanding of the 2.25% convertible notes due Aug. 1, 2012, for capital expenditures on the Creole Trail Pipeline and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $290.9M (+17.9% Y/Y)...

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $290.9M (+17.9% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • MFRM

    Shares of Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) are getting hammered in after-hours trading, now down over...

    Shares of Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) are getting hammered in after-hours trading, now down over 7.7% after lowering its sales outlook. The firm now expects to earn a Q2 EPS $0.27 - $0.29, below previous estimates of $0.26 - $0.29. Sales are now expected be come in around $270M - $275M, missing expectations of $274M. Shares -7.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) -4.1% AH after providing details about a previously-announced stock...

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) -4.1% AH after providing details about a previously-announced stock offering to be made on behalf of insiders. 11.7M shares will be sold, and those selling include VC investors and chairman/CEO Godfrey R. Sullivan. The company's IPO share lock-up expires on October 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • CDMO

    More on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): FQ4 beats on a per share basis, but comes up short on...

    More on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): FQ4 beats on a per share basis, but comes up short on revenue due to a 23% Y/Y decline in total sales. Total revenues for FY12 were $15.2M however, compared to $13.5M in the prior year period. The Y/Y increase was primarily attributed to a boost in contract manufacturing revenue from its subsidiary Avid Bioservices. Shares +2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • CDXS

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) +11.4% AH after signing an exclusive negotiation agreement with Royal...

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) +11.4% AH after signing an exclusive negotiation agreement with Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) which would grant to CDXS certain rights and licenses in the biofuels field to develop and sell cellulase enzymes to third parties on a worldwide basis except Brazil.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): FQ2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $77.3M (-0.6% Y/Y) misses...

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): FQ2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $77.3M (-0.6% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • AABA

    In a stunner, Marissa Mayer, the head of Google's local services ops, has been named the new CEO...

    In a stunner, Marissa Mayer, the head of Google's local services ops, has been named the new CEO of Yahoo, instead of interim CEO Ross Levinsohn. YHOO +3.6% AH. GOOG -0.5%. Update: Yahoo has issued a PR confirming the move.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 8 Comments
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.26B...

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.26B (+10% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • WOOF

    It's a dog day afternoon for animal health care companies VCA Antech (WOOF -7.1%) and...

    It's a dog day afternoon for animal health care companies VCA Antech (WOOF -7.1%) and MWI Veterinary (MWIV -5.1%) after William Blair is bearish on their upcoming earnings results, noting a warm winter and early start to the flea and tick season that drew sales forward from the latest quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +9.2%) extends gains following a WSJ article that the company expects to begin...

    Supervalu (SVU +9.2%) extends gains following a WSJ article that the company expects to begin sending out financial information in the coming days to prospective buyers, including buyout firms and other supermarket operators and distributors. SVU said last week it had hired bankers to look at selling either part or all of itself. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 6 Comments
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) stay on their downward spiral to trade 8.4% lower...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) stay on their downward spiral to trade 8.4% lower at $18.04 a pop. With no news of note out on the company, investors may be getting jittery about holding the much-maligned stock ahead of GMCR's FQ3 report scheduled to be released later this month or in early August.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.3%) adds to Friday's Buffett-fueled gains as Oppenheimer starts coverage at...

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.3%) adds to Friday's Buffett-fueled gains as Oppenheimer starts coverage at Outperform with a $42 price target. The firm likes PSX's strategy of de-emphasizing refining while aggressively expanding in gas processing and petrochemicals, believing the asset mix, large scale and balanced operations offer a competitive advantage throughout the business cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.8%) trade lower after the New York Knicks sign an...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG -1.8%) trade lower after the New York Knicks sign an apparent replacement for player Jeremy Lin - despite the boost Linsanity provided on and off the court last season. Cynics note that the company has lost off its market cap in today's action more than the equivalent of matching an offer for Lin's services from an opposing team.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • AXP

    Shares of American Express (AXP +1.3%) also enjoy a boost following the settlement between rival...

    Shares of American Express (AXP +1.3%) also enjoy a boost following the settlement between rival card issuers and retailers. AXP benefits because MasterCard and Visa would lower their fees less than expected and thus "can continue to charge its current rates and won’t see meaningful pricing pressure," Susquehanna says. Capital One (COF +2.3%) also should benefit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • V

    The settlement between merchants and credit card firms isn't only a win for merchants, as...

    The settlement between merchants and credit card firms isn't only a win for merchants, as Deutsche Bank's Bryan Keane argues it's also time for investors to "aggressively buy" Visa (V +2%) and MasterCard (MA +2%): "The agreement does nothing to increase competition (e.g., freedom of routing) or damage the networks’ dominant positions... a big risk [is] removed."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +6.6%) hits a new 52-week high after Raymond James reaffirms its Outperform rating...

    InterOil (IOC +6.6%) hits a new 52-week high after Raymond James reaffirms its Outperform rating on the stock and raises its price target to $100 from $70.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +6.3%) are higher today in anticipation that the FDA will soon approve its...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +6.3%) are higher today in anticipation that the FDA will soon approve its diet drug Qnexa. A decision is expected to be issued by the end of tomorrow. If approved, the drug - which was rejected initially in its first attempt - will be the second weight loss drug to be approved by the regulatory body in the past two months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 6 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -4.3%), which had strongly outperformed the NASDAQ from early June to early July,...

    Facebook (FB -4.3%), which had strongly outperformed the NASDAQ from early June to early July, is notably underperforming today. Shares are now off 11% from their July 9 high. Evercore's Ken Sena, who started coverage with a Hold in June, thinks recent weakness in Zynga and Groupon is finally catching up to Facebook.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • CAT

    Wondering why Caterpillar (CAT -1.4%) still lags the market? Just blame it on oil says Motley...

    Wondering why Caterpillar (CAT -1.4%) still lags the market? Just blame it on oil says Motley Fool contributor Lior Cohen. CAT has benefited in the past from big moves in oil as firms ramped up demand for engines and turbines for petroleum applications, but as oil prices dwindled and demand faded over the recent quarter, investors remain more than a little bit queasy about the company's upcoming financial report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +5.7%) will submit a design for a Phase II trial of an oral version of...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +5.7%) will submit a design for a Phase II trial of an oral version of its tumor drug Proellex in the next few days as the company attempts to persuade the FDA to lift a suspension on testing of the treatment. The FDA put a study of Proellex on hold in 2009 due to liver toxicity issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • DNKN

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +3.8%) run higher after Piper Jaffray's recent upgrade to an...

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +3.8%) run higher after Piper Jaffray's recent upgrade to an Overweight rating looks a little more impressive after it takes down other restaurant chains. A common thread from DNKN bulls is that the headline P-E ratio looks pricey mainly due to one-time expenses the company will outlive, but is justifiable given the large growth track the company remains on.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • MDVN

    Bloomberg fingers Medivation (MDVN +4.1%) as a potential takeover target in its "Real M&A"...

    Bloomberg fingers Medivation (MDVN +4.1%) as a potential takeover target in its "Real M&A" column, which should really be entitled "Fantasy M&A." The stock has quadrupled in the past year on excitement that its enzalutamide treatment for prostate cancer will soon get FDA approval and then become a blockbuster. "It's...our obligation to remain open to all available options," says Medivation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • RNF

    Rising corn prices (CORN +3.3%) continue to prove good news for shares of fertilizer products...

    Rising corn prices (CORN +3.3%) continue to prove good news for shares of fertilizer products maker Rentech Nitrogen Partners (RNF +5.4%), up ~30% in the past month. Nitrogen fertilizer demand is driven by corn acreage and production yields, which are in turn driven by corn prices and gross farm revenue per acre.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -1.2%) and Lowe's (LOW -2.6%) slump after a soft report for June retail...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -1.2%) and Lowe's (LOW -2.6%) slump after a soft report for June retail store sales shows particular weakness in areas that could effect the DIY names. Building material sales fell to $23.65M during the month, from $24.05M in May.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • BIOF

    If prices for corn (CORN +3%) are rising and demand is falling, why are BioFuel Energy (BIOF...

    If prices for corn (CORN +3%) are rising and demand is falling, why are BioFuel Energy (BIOF +25%) and Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +11.8%) enjoying such big spikes today? Production closures appear to have taken enough ethanol off the market to support rising costs of corn and put some profit back into ethanol makers, 24/7's Paul Ausick writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZTCOY

    Some telecom equipment names slump after ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOY) becomes the latest vendor to warn....

    Some telecom equipment names slump after ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOY) becomes the latest vendor to warn. CIEN -3.2%. ALU -3.1%. ERIC -1.4%. Particularly worrisome may be ZTE's remarks about delayed orders from Chinese carriers, given how China, thanks to its heavy broadband spending, has remained an area of strength amidst a soft telecom capex environment. ZTE has also emerged a top-5 mobile phone vendor, thanks partly to strong Android sales. (Adtran) (Calix) (Acme Packet)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) now surging 37% on heavy volume following positive Phase I...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) now surging 37% on heavy volume following positive Phase I trial results for ALN-TTR02, a treatment for a genetic mutation of the transthyretin gene. The mutation causes a hereditary, systemic disease called ATTR, which can damage body organs and tissue such as the peripheral nerves and heart.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • ANDE

    Shares of Andersons (ANDE -3.27%) slide today over fears of a worsening drought in the U.S....

    Shares of Andersons (ANDE -3.27%) slide today over fears of a worsening drought in the U.S. Midwest. With the majority of the company's operations located in the eastern Midwest - where the drought is particularly acute -investors appear to be focusing on Andersons's reliance on corn for its ethanol plants.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • ISR

    Microcap Med-tech company IsoRay (ISR -23%) takes a hit after it announces a direct placement of...

    Microcap Med-tech company IsoRay (ISR -23%) takes a hit after it announces a direct placement of approximately $3.5M shares at a price of $0.965 per share. a 34% discount to Friday's closing price. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund marketing efforts for its GliaSite, and new emerging cancer solutions for internal radiation therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • BID

    Sotheby's (BID -5.1%) trades weak after Craig-Hallum takes its rating on the auction house down...

    Sotheby's (BID -5.1%) trades weak after Craig-Hallum takes its rating on the auction house down to Hold from Buy. Growth headwinds in China for Sotheby's and its upcoming tough comparables has the investment firm sitting on the sidelines for the time being.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +4.7%) rallies after announcing NRG Energy's (NYSE:NRG) Agua Caliente solar...

    First Solar (FSLR +4.7%) rallies after announcing NRG Energy's (NYSE:NRG) Agua Caliente solar plant, in which Berkshire Hathaway's MidAmerican Energy has taken a 49% stake, is now more than 2/3 complete, and has over 200MW of installed capacity. Agua Caliente, which has received a DOE loan guarantee and is being constructed and operated by First Solar, is expected to be completed in 2014. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC +7.2%) enjoys a nice bounce following Friday's 11% slide on expectations...

    James River Coal (JRCC +7.2%) enjoys a nice bounce following Friday's 11% slide on expectations of lower Q3 coal production from peer Consol Energy (CNX -2.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • NCR

    NCR gains 3.6% after Barron's argues sales of the company's point-of-sale (POS) systems...

    NCR gains 3.6% after Barron's argues sales of the company's point-of-sale (POS) systems will fare well in a low-growth environment, due to their high return on investment. Strong emerging markets exposure, new banking hardware solutions, and a diverse product line are seen as offsetting hefty pension obligations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • SONC

    Shares of a number of restaurant chain operators trade lower after Piper Jaffray hits Panera...

    Shares of a number of restaurant chain operators trade lower after Piper Jaffray hits Panera Bread and Sonic (SONC -4.6%) with harsh two-level downgrades. Though analysts with Piper cite specific execution risks at both companies, the sentiment in the actions seems to have filtered down to hit smaller-sized names in the sector. BAGL -2.7%, THI -2.5%, NATH -2.6%, CBOU -2.3%, PZZI -3.3%, DPZ -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • GSK

    More on GSK-Human Genome deal. GSK (GSK +0.2%) finally gets HGS (HGSI +3%) after a protracted...

    More on GSK-Human Genome deal. GSK (GSK +0.2%) finally gets HGS (HGSI +3%) after a protracted fight and increasing the offer from $2.8B or $13/share. While the deal is worth $3.6B on an equity basis, it's valued at $3B net of cash and debt. The $14.25/share offer is almost double HGSI's closing price of $7.17 on 18 April, just prior to GSK's initial proposal being made public. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • AUTH

    AuthenTec (AUTH +12.2%) jumps after announcing Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is integrating the company's...

    AuthenTec (AUTH +12.2%) jumps after announcing Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is integrating the company's QuickSec VPN software in its Android phones and tablets. Samsung has an increasingly dominant share of the Android smartphone market (particularly on the high-end), and is stepping up its efforts to outfit its phones with the security and device-management features sought by enterprises. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • GSK

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) agrees to acquire Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) for $3.6B, or $14.25 a...

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) agrees to acquire Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) for $3.6B, or $14.25 a share. HGSI shares +3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) +10.4% premarket after the drug maker says the FDA had accepted for review...

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) +10.4% premarket after the drug maker says the FDA had accepted for review its lead investigational product candidate for the treatment of chronic pain. The goal for a standard review of a new drug application is 10 months from submission, and the FDA has assigned a target action date of March 1, 2013 for the Zohydro ER NDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) -5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q2. NSPH sees Q2...

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) -5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q2. NSPH sees Q2 revenues of $1.3M, +160% Y/Y but lower than the consensus estimate of $1.5M. Customer placements totaled 25, bringing cumulative placements to 166.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) moves 6.1% higher premarket after Goldman Sachs chimes in with an upgrade...

    Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) moves 6.1% higher premarket after Goldman Sachs chimes in with an upgrade to Neutral from Sell. The firm says last week's selloff in shares brings the stock's risk-reward profile back in balance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures maintain their losses after retail sales unexpectedly contract and...

    Market preview: Stock futures maintain their losses after retail sales unexpectedly contract and despite decent manufacturing data out of New York, with the S&P Benchmark -0.3%. Citigroup is +4.1% following earnings , although Woodward is -16.8% after a profit warning. Visa (+2.65%) and MasterCard (+2.2%) make steady gains in the wake of their $7.25B settlement with merchants. Later: Business Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) +9.4% premarket after the biotech firm says a study showed...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) +9.4% premarket after the biotech firm says a study showed ALN-TTR02, a potential treatment for a genetic mutation of the transthyretin gene, reduced serum TTR protein levels in a way that was "rapid, dose dependent, durable, and specific after just a single dose."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • PRX

    Premarket gainers: PRX +39%. CONM +13%. AUTH +13%. SVU +6%. Losers: ISR -19%. NSPH -6%. ANR -6%.

    Premarket gainers: PRX +39%. CONM +13%. AUTH +13%. SVU +6%.
    Losers: ISR -19%. NSPH -6%. ANR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • WWD

    Shares of aerospace and defense industry supplier Woodward (NASDAQ:WWD) fall 20.2% premarket...

    Shares of aerospace and defense industry supplier Woodward (NASDAQ:WWD) fall 20.2% premarket after the company cuts estimates for Q3 below the consensus forecast from analysts. The company now sees revenue of $460M and EPS of $0.40 for the quarter due to weak demand in the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • GCI

    More on Gannett's (NYSE:GCI) Q2: Publishing advertising revenue slipped 8.1% Y/Y to $594M, while...

    More on Gannett's (NYSE:GCI) Q2: Publishing advertising revenue slipped 8.1% Y/Y to $594M, while broadcast revenue gained 11.4% to $205M. Page views of the company's mobile news apps +154% Y/Y. Sees strong demand for digital marketing services contributing to results. Shares +1.4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • E

    Eni (NYSE:E) -1.7% premarket after shareholders approve scrapping the Italian oil and gas...

    Eni (NYSE:E) -1.7% premarket after shareholders approve scrapping the Italian oil and gas company's treasury shares as part of a share buyback program. Also, the company says it expects to make a final decision in late 2012 or early 2013 on the South Stream natural gas pipeline project envisioned to carry up to 63B/year cubic meters of Russian gas under the Black Sea to Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) and Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) gap lower in premarket trading after both...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) and Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) gap lower in premarket trading after both coal companies are downgraded (I, II) to Underperform at BMOCapital, based on weak Appalachian coal demand, high debt levels and deteriorating margins. ANR -5.4%, ACI -5.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • PRX

    TPG agrees to acquire Par Pharmaceutical (NYSE:PRX) for $1.9B, or $50/share, which represents a...

    TPG agrees to acquire Par Pharmaceutical (NYSE:PRX) for $1.9B, or $50/share, which represents a 37% premium over Par's closing price on Friday. Shares +36% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • V

    Consumers will see extra charges when they use plastic as a byproduct of the massive settlement...

    Consumers will see extra charges when they use plastic as a byproduct of the massive settlement between retailers and credit card companies. Merchants have wider authority to add a surcharge for credit card transactions as part of the historic deal. Premarket: V +3.2%, MA +4.1%, AXP +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM | 15 Comments
  • ZTCOF

    Despite hopes of additional stimulus, Chinese stocks fell heavily on earnings concerns;...

    Despite hopes of additional stimulus, Chinese stocks fell heavily on earnings concerns; benchmark index -1.8%. In particular, ZTE Corp., China's second-largest telecom maker, fell by the daily trading limit of 10% after warning H1 profits may have declined as much as 80%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 AM | 1 Comment
